question: Who inagurates Gujarat University's Centre for Spoken Sanskrit?
explanation: Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh launched Gujarat University's Centre for Spoken Sanskrit that will provide a spoken Sanskrit course. The Gujarat University has introduced a spoken Sanskrit course for a six-month duration. This course will teach people how to speak Sanskrit. This course is said to be the first of its kind in India. This course has been introduced to familiarize Sanskrit in India. The course fees is Rs.500. This course doesn't require any prior knowledge of Sanskrit. Also an advanced course on sanskrit grammar will be launched for interested students helping them to read and understand ancient scriptures.
